page.title: 10The Marathon, Kingswood.
page.content: The{Kingswood District Marathon}is the first event of the Annual {Kingswood Festival}and it starts and finishes in Page Park. The hilly two lap course of{26.2 miles}passes through some of the major population areas, posing many problems for the runners, as well as lack of water and overheating. Up to{50,000 spectators watch the average turnout of{500 {runners.}The largest entry was 1,300 in 1982. The oldest entrants are over 70 and the minimum age is 18 years. There have been 6 Marathons over the last 5 years. The record holder is {David Francis: 2 hrs. 23 mins.}The 1985 winner was Rod Cornish. The event is sponsored by{Brooks,}the sports shoe firm. The winner receives a cup and a television set. Everyone who completes the course receives a medallion.
